member.name: T:SourceAFIS.Simple.AfisEngine
member.summary: Methods and settings of SourceAFIS fingerprint matching engine.

remarks.para: This class is an entry point to core SourceAFIS functionality. After setting relevant properties (notably ), application can call one of the three main methods (, , ) to perform template extraction and fingerprint matching.

objects are thread-safe, i.e. synchronized. is a lightweight object, but application is encouraged to keep only one global AfisEngine instance anyway. Every method utilizes multiple cores automatically. Applications that wish to execute several methods of in parallel should create multiple objects, perhaps one per thread.

member.name: M:SourceAFIS.Simple.AfisEngine.#ctor
member.summary: Create new SourceAFIS engine.

member.name: M:SourceAFIS.Simple.AfisEngine.Extract(SourceAFIS.Simple.Person)
member.summary: Extract fingerprint template(s) to be used during matching.
member.param: Person object to use for template extraction.

remarks.para: method takes from every in and constructs fingerprint template that it stores in property of the respective . This step must be performed before the is used in or method, because matching is done on fingerprint templates, not on fingerprint images.
Fingerprint image can be discarded after extraction, but it is recommended to keep it in case the needs to be regenerated due to SourceAFIS upgrade or other reason.

member.name: M:SourceAFIS.Simple.AfisEngine.Verify(SourceAFIS.Simple.Person,SourceAFIS.Simple.Person)
member.summary: Compute similarity score between two s.
member.param: First of the two persons to compare.
Second of the two persons to compare.
member.returns: Similarity score indicating similarity between the two persons or 0 if there is no match.

remarks.para: method compares two s, by , and returns floating-point similarity score that indicates degree of similarity between the two s. If this score falls below , method returns zero.
s passed to this method must have valid for every , i.e. they must have passed through method.

member.name: M:SourceAFIS.Simple.AfisEngine.Identify(SourceAFIS.Simple.Person,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{SourceAFIS.Simple.Person})
member.summary: Compares one against a set of other s and returns best matches.
member.param: Person to look up in the collection.
Collection of persons that will be searched.
member.returns: All matching objects in the collection or an empty collection if there is no match. Results are sorted by score in descending order. If you need only one best match, call method on the returned collection.

remarks.para: Compares probe to all candidate s and returns the most similar candidates. Calling is conceptually identical to calling in a loop except that is significantly faster than loop of calls. If there is no candidate with score at or above , returns empty collection.

Most applications need only the best match, which can be obtained by calling method on the returned collection. Matching score for every returned can be obtained by calling on probe and the matching .
s passed to this method must have valid for every , i.e. they must have passed through method.

member.name: P:SourceAFIS.Simple.AfisEngine.Dpi
member.summary: Get/set DPI for processed images.
member.value: DPI of images submitted for template extraction. Default is 500.

remarks.para: DPI of common optical fingerprint readers is 500. For other types of readers as well as for high-resolution readers, you might need to change this property to reflect capabilities of your reader. This value is used only during template extraction (). Matching is not affected, because extraction process rescales all templates to 500dpi internally.

Setting DPI causes extractor to adjust its parameters to the DPI. It therefore helps with accuracy. Correct DPI also allows matching of fingerprints coming from different readers. When matching children's fingerprints, it is sometimes useful to fool the extractor with lower DPI setting to deal with the tiny ridges on fingers of children.

member.name: P:SourceAFIS.Simple.AfisEngine.Threshold
member.summary: Get/set similarity score threshold.
member.value: Similarity score threshold for making match/non-match decisions. Default value is rather arbitrarily set to 25.

remarks.para: Matching algorithm produces similarity score which is a measure of similarity between two fingerprints. Applications however need clear match/non-match decisions. is used to turn similarity score into match/non-match decision. Similarity score at or above is considered match. Lower score is considered non-match. This property is used by and methods to make match decisions.

Appropriate is application-specific. Application developer must adjust this property to reflect differences in fingerprint readers, population, and application requirements. Start with default threshold. If there are too many false accepts (SourceAFIS reports match for fingerprints from two different people), increase the . If there are too many false rejects (SourceAFIS reports non-match for two fingerprints of the same person), decrease the . Every application eventually arrives at some reasonable balance between FAR (false accept ratio) and FRR (false reject ratio).

member.name: P:SourceAFIS.Simple.AfisEngine.MinMatches
member.summary: Get/set minimum number of fingerprints that must match in order for a whole person to match.
member.value: Number of fingerprints that must match during multi-finger matching. Default value is 1 (person matches if any of its fingerprints matches).

remarks.para: When there are multiple s per , SourceAFIS compares every probe to every candidate and takes the best match, the one with highest similarity score. This behavior improves FRR (false reject rate), because low similarity scores caused by damaged fingerprints are ignored. This happens when is 1 (default).

When is 2 or higher, SourceAFIS compares every probe to every candidate and records score for every comparison. It then sorts collected partial scores in descending order and picks score that is on position specified by property, e.g. 2nd score if is 2, 3rd score if is 3, etc. When combined with , this property essentially specifies how many partial scores must be above in order for the whole to match. As a special case, when there are too few partial scores (less than value of ), SourceAFIS picks the lowest score.

is useful in some rare cases where there is significant risk that some fingerprint might match randomly with high score due to a broken template or due to some rarely occuring matcher flaw. In these cases, might improve FAR. This is discouraged practice though. Application developers seeking ways to improve FAR would do much better to increase . can be safely raised to levels where FAR is essentially zero as far as fingerprints are of good quality.

member.name: T:SourceAFIS.Simple.Finger
member.summary: Finger position on hand.

remarks.para: Finger position is used to speed up matching by skipping fingerprint pairs that cannot match due to incompatible position. SourceAFIS will return zero similarity score for incompatible fingerprint pairs.
This feature is optional. It can be disabled by using finger position which is default value of for new objects.

A compatible fingerprint pair consists of two fingerprints with the same finger position, e.g. matches only other . Alternatively, compatible fingerprint pair can be also formed if one of the fingerprints has finger position, e.g. can be matched against all other finger positions and all other finger positions can be matched against . Two fingerprints with positions are compatible as well, of course.

member.name: T:SourceAFIS.Simple.Fingerprint
member.summary: Collection of fingerprint-related information.

remarks.para: This class contains basic information (, ) about the fingerprint that is used by SourceAFIS to perform template extraction and fingerprint matching. If you need to attach application-specific information to object, inherit from this class and add fields as necessary. objects can be grouped in objects.

This class is designed to be easy to serialize in order to be stored in binary format (BLOB) in application database, binary or XML files, or sent over network. You can either serialize the whole object or serialize individual properties. You can set some properties to to exclude them from serialization.

member.name: M:SourceAFIS.Simple.Fingerprint.#ctor
member.summary: Creates empty object.

member.name: M:SourceAFIS.Simple.Fingerprint.Clone
member.summary: Create deep copy of the .

member.name: P:SourceAFIS.Simple.Fingerprint.Image
member.summary: Fingerprint image.
member.value: Raw fingerprint image that was used to extract the or other image attached later after extraction. This property is by default.

remarks.para: This is the fingerprint image. This property must be set before call to in order to generate valid . Once the is generated, property has only informational meaning and it can be set to to save space. It is however recommended to keep the original image just in case it is needed to regenerate the in future.

The format of this image is a simple raw 2D array of s. Every byte represents shade of gray from black (0) to white (255). When indexing the 2D array, Y axis goes first, X axis goes second, e.g. Image[y, x]. To convert to/from object, use property. To convert to/from object, use property.
Accessors of this property do not clone the image. To avoid unwanted sharing of the array, call on the .

member.name: P:SourceAFIS.Simple.Fingerprint.AsImageData
member.summary: Fingerprint image as raw image in byte array.
member.value: Fingerprint image from property converted to raw image (one-dimensional byte array) or if is .

member.name: P:SourceAFIS.Simple.Fingerprint.AsBitmapSource
member.summary: Fingerprint image as object.
member.value: Fingerprint image from property converted to object or if is .
member.remarks: Use this property in WPF applications.

member.name: P:SourceAFIS.Simple.Fingerprint.AsBitmap
member.summary: Fingerprint image as object.
member.value: Fingerprint image from property converted to object or if is .
member.remarks: Use this property in WinForms applications.

member.name: P:SourceAFIS.Simple.Fingerprint.Template
member.summary: Fingerprint template.
member.value: Fingerprint template generated by or other template assigned for example after deserialization. This property is by default.

remarks.para: Fingerprint template is an abstract model of the fingerprint that is serialized in a very compact binary format (up to a few KB). Templates are better than fingerprint images, because they require less space and they are easier to match than images. To generate , pass object with valid to . is required by and .
Format of the template may change in later versions of SourceAFIS. Applications are recommended to keep the original in order to be able to regenerate the .

member.name: P:SourceAFIS.Simple.Fingerprint.AsIsoTemplate
member.summary: Fingerprint template in standard ISO format.
member.value: Value of converted to standard ISO/IEC 19794-2 (2005) format. This property is if is .

remarks.para: Use this property for two-way exchange of fingerprint templates with other biometric systems. For general use in SourceAFIS, use property which contains native template that is fine-tuned for best accuracy and performance in SourceAFIS.

SourceAFIS contains partial implementation of ISO/IEC 19794-2 (2005) standard. Multi-fingerprint ISO templates must be split into individual fingerprints before they are used in SourceAFIS. Value of property is not automatically stored in the ISO template. It must be decoded separately.

member.name: P:SourceAFIS.Simple.Fingerprint.AsXmlTemplate
member.summary: Fingerprint template in readable XML format.
member.value: Value of converted to SourceAFIS XML template format. This property is if is .

remarks.para: Use XML template format where clean data format is more important than compact and fast encoding. XML templates are suitable for XML-based data exchange, encoding of multiple fingerprints along with accompanying data into single XML file, and for debugging and logging purposes.
Value of property is not automatically stored in the XML template. It must be decoded separately.

member.name: P:SourceAFIS.Simple.Fingerprint.Finger
member.summary: Position of the finger on hand.
member.value: Finger (thumb to little) and hand (right or left) that was used to create this fingerprint. Default value means unspecified finger position.
member.remarks: Finger position is used to speed up matching by skipping fingerprint pairs with incompatible finger positions. Check enumeration for information on how to control this process. Default value disables this behavior.

member.name: T:SourceAFIS.Simple.Person
member.summary: Collection of s belonging to one person.

remarks.para: This class is primarily a way to group multiple s belonging to one person. This is very convenient feature when there are multiple fingerprints per person, because it is possible to match two s directly instead of iterating over their s.
property is provided as a simple means to bind objects to application-specific information. If you need more flexibility, inherit from class and add application-specific fields as necessary.

This class is designed to be easy to serialize in order to be stored in binary format (BLOB) in application database, binary or XML files, or sent over network. You can either serialize the whole or serialize individual s.

member.name: M:SourceAFIS.Simple.Person.#ctor
member.summary: Creates an empty object.

member.summary: Create deep copy of the .
member.remarks: This method also clones all objects contained in this .

member.name: P:SourceAFIS.Simple.Person.Id
member.summary: Application-assigned ID for the .

remarks.para: SourceAFIS doesn't use this property. It is provided for applications as an easy means to link objects back to application-specific data. Applications can store any integer ID in this field, for example database table key or an array index.
Applications that need to attach more detailed information to the person should inherit from class and add fields as necessary.

member.name: P:SourceAFIS.Simple.Person.Fingerprints
member.summary: List of s belonging to the .
member.remarks: This collection is initially empty. Add objects here. You can also assign the whole collection.
